title: Archive folder--can't delete
content:
I have several accounts in Thunderbird. I have never (intentionally) used the archive option. Yet, one of my accounts now has an Archive folder that I cannot delete. No option exists when right clicking the folder and I cannot drag it to the trash. It has no emails in it, and never has. Its possible its been there a while and I just didn't notice, bu AFAIK its new.

I have gone to Account Settings Copies & Folders...and the "Keep Message Archives in:" is unchecked. Further, I checked all accounts to see if one of those might be 'checked'...just with a folder specified in a different (wrong) account. Not it.

I've restarted. I'm at a loss as to how to clean this up.

Any help would be appreciated.

Thunderbird 144.01...that I upgraded to 145.0 when checking the version to report here. No change.
creator: thunderbirder

title: layout when a message from the IN Box is open
content: 15 Nov. 2025 I contacted a very savvy computer consultant in my area, and he was able to connect my Thunderbird to my Google account, so I can finally use my Thunderbird software again. In the past, I always had the list of my contacts on the left side of my screen, aligned vertically, when I had an open message on my screen. That is missing now. I would like to restore that feature, and I cannot find a way to do that. Thank you.

title: Thunderbird office 365 calendar support
content:
I'm using the latest version (145) and I've setup my office 365 email account. I'm trying to setup my calendar account as well but when I enter location, username and password it says that my credentials were not accepted.

I assume this means that TB is using legacy un/pw authentication which is no longer supported instead of OATH2. There is, however, no option to select OATH2 in the calendar setup process (like there is for email).

Are office 365 calendars supported by TB 145?

title: APERTURA AUTOMATICA STRANA
content: Da qualche giorno, Thunderbird apre automaticamente le cartelle di una determinata email. È fastidioso perché le email successive "scorrono" verso il basso, il che è incredibilmente fastidioso. Perché apre automaticamente quell'email, poi la posta in arrivo, la cartella Inviati e varie sottocartelle? Spero di essermi spiegato chiaramente. Grazie! Sono italiano ho scritto in inglese perché ho fatto vari post sui social... For a few days now, Thunderbird has been automatically opening the folders for a certain email. This is annoying because subsequent emails "slide" down, which is incredibly annoying. Why does it automatically open that email, then the inbox, sent folders, and various subfolders? I hope I explained myself clearly. Thanks!

title: How to troubleshoot EWS connections?
content:
So I have a self hosted Exchange and I have no problems using it from apps like Google Mail, Outlook and such, plus I can login directly to its .../EWS/Exchange.asmx through a browser. However, when trying with Thunderbird 145/Linux, I always get that username or password are incorrect, but it doesn't tell me exactly what went wrong and how it tried, so I'm in the dark why it is happening. Note: exchange's url is on a different domain than my account.

Basically it's either this message: Authentication error.

Component returned failure code: 0x80004005 (NS_ERROR_FAILURE) [nsIMsgAccountManager.createIncomingServer]

Or similar if I try to get message from inbox.

Also weird things happen during configuration, like attached image (note that I've tried different URL permutations)

TLDR; how do I diagnose the issue, or ever better, how to connect? TIA
creator: miha3

title: "Make address book entry" from email addresses in incoming message
content: I have what may be a very simple question. Say I receive an email in which I am one of many people getting the message - as in a message that has gone out to all 10 members of some committee of which I'm a member. I would like to make an entry in my personal address book for the Committee that would include all 10 addresses. Is there an easy way to do this besides (a) individually saving each of the addresses for the Committee members and (b) creating a new address book entry and (c) individually adding each of the 10 committee members? Thanks!

title: Since TB145, nextcloud calendar integration seems broken
content:
Hi,

since Thunderbird 145 installed, I can't update my Nextcloud calendars anymore. Neither new calendar entries are created, nor can I delete them, nor can I acknowledge a reminder. - The create dialog simply closes, no error message, but also no calendar entry. - The Delete button when editing a calendar entry just animates it's being pressed. Nothing else happens. - The reminders window does not close. Neither for a single reminder, nor dismissing all reminders does anything except animating the button press.

I (thought a long time about this and then) tried to unsubscribe from the calendars and tried to add them again. Not a good idea: Now TB only shows "Searching your calendars" indefinitely (for hours). This is regardless of whether I add a username for logon or tick the "no credentials needed" box - to me, that seems to indicate TB is not communication at all with Nextcloud.

This all worked fine before the TB 145 update :-(

Using Nextcloud Hub 10 (31.0.10).

Any hints?

Danke & Grüße von nobi
creator: virtualnobi

title: remote content exceptions

creator: gregsan99

title: Password change and pin
content:
Spectrum had me change my password for one of my accounts on Thunderbird. I changed it with Spectrum. That account was working fine from Nov. 6 until today, Nov. 16; today, it decided that my password wouldn't work. I tried to change it when it asked at the time I was trying to send an email; it wouldn't take. I then went into "saved passwords" and tried to change it; it wanted a pin. This is my** first problem;** Norton has no idea what that is. Thunderbird asked for other sign-in methods including a Yahoo email, but I have no idea what it wants as it doesn't want the password for that Yahoo account. What is it looking for????

I deleted the account from Thunderbird's password manager. After my shutting down and reopening Thunderbird a few times, it finally worked --however, it didn't ask for a password and sent and received email just fine. Thunderbird now doesn't have that account listed in its password manager, but is giving me my mail and sending my mail out without asking me for a password. **This is my second problem.**

Since this is all combined, I'm sending both questions together; otherwise, I wouldn't do so. Does anyone know what's happening and how to get a password back as a necessity for that email account?
creator: DorothyJ
